FuncDef:
The transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command enables the global filtering function for alarm messages and sets an interval for filtering alarm messages.
The undo transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command disables the global filtering function for alarm messages.
By default, the global filtering function for alarm messages is not enabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interval for filtering delayed alarm messages. (If an alarm message is received within the interval, the message is filtered. Otherwise, the alarm is responded to.).
The value is an integer ranging from 20 to 10000, in milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The frequent generation of alarms causes the interface status to continuously alternate between Up and Down at the physical layer. To enable the interface to ignore alarms and clear alarms within a specified interval, run the transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command to set an interval for filtering alarm-clear messages.
Prerequisites
The alarm customization function has been enabled on an interface.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Specify the holdoff-time parameter based on the flapping frequency of an interface.
If this command is run in the system view and the non-default configuration of this command exists in the interface view, the configuration on the interface takes effect. If the configuration in the interface view is the default configuration, the global configuration takes effect.
